name: Harvard Humanitarian Initiative

fields.Org Description: The Harvard Humanitarian Initiative (HHI) is a university-wide academic and research center in humanitarian crisis and leadership. Our mission is to create new knowledge and advance evidence-based leadership in disasters and humanitarian crisis. Our work focuses on two main areas: the Humanitarian Academy at Harvard and Research & Translation.

fields.Country Name: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

fields.Project Description: Humanitarian Geoanalytics integrates spatial data analysis, mapping, and field-based research to support humanitarian operations. It focuses on conflict dynamics, displacement, and vulnerability assessments using geospatial methods.

The Signal Program explores how emerging technologies—like remote sensing and data analytics—can support protection in humanitarian emergencies. It develops tools, ethical frameworks, and applied research for crisis contexts.

KoboToolbox is a free and open-source tool for mobile data collection in humanitarian crises. Used by UN agencies, NGOs, and governments, it supports offline surveys, real-time dashboards, and collaborative field assessments.

HHI is an academic and applied research center focused on advancing humanitarian response through evidence-based practice, data science, and technology. It bridges academia, practitioners, and policy stakeholders.

donor_countries: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

fields.Org Description: HeiGIT (Heidelberg Institute for Geoinformation Technology) advances geoinformation technology for the benefit of society and the environment. We bridge the gap between fundamental research in geoinformatics and practical applications by developing innovative tools and methods. Examples include customized geodata for humanitarian missions and intelligent routing for disaster response and climate action.

fields.Project Description: HeiGIT develops open geospatial tools and APIs—such as OpenRouteService—to support disaster response, health logistics, and mobility mapping. Its platforms process global spatial data to enable routing, accessibility, and hazard analysis.

fields.Agency/Department Name: Federal Agency for Cartography and Geodesy (BKG)

fields.Org Description: The UK Humanitarian Innovation Hub supports and accelerates data-related projects that aim to improve humanitarian response, collaborating with various actors including academia, the private sector, and other innovation hubs. While not a direct provider of data services, the Hub facilitates research and development in areas like predictive analytics, the ethical use of technology, and the application of data science to understand and respond to humanitarian needs. Their work involves assessing existing models and forecasts, designing trigger mechanisms for anticipatory action, and guiding the humanitarian community on climate science and its implications. The Hub also draws on insights from the Centre for Humanitarian Data and its Humanitarian Data Exchange (HDX) platform, which makes humanitarian data easily accessible for analysis and decision-making.

fields.Project Description: A collaborative innovation lab promoting data-driven solutions in crisis settings. It supports tools prototyping and open datasets for humanitarian innovation.

fields.Org Description: The Barcelona School of Economics (BSE) was founded in 2006 by Andreu Mas-Colell as an institution for scientific cooperation between four academic units: two university departments and two research centers with a long tradition of collaboration and a history of leadership in the field of Economics.
fields.Org Mission: BSE aims to promote the creation and transmission of frontier knowledge in Economics and related disciplines, by consolidating Barcelona as a world-class center of research, academic education, and professional training with the ultimate goals of informing policy and promoting economic and social wellbeing.

fields.Project Description: We specialize in conflict forecasting, prevention, and decision support. Our forecasting methodology is explicitly designed to detect new, subtle signals of conflict risk in countries not currently at war. Detecting these risks is extremely difficult and requires accepting false positives. We then integrate these predictions into a novel policy evaluation tool to assess the tradeoff between the benefits of preventive action and the costs of acting on false-positive signals.

fields.Org Description: UNICEF’s Data Team is the global go-to for data on children. It leads the collection, validation, analysis, use and communication of the most statistically sound, internationally comparable data on the situation of children and women around the world.

fields.Agency/Department Name: Directorate-General for European Civil Protection and Humanitarian Aid Operations (DG ECHO)

fields.Project Description: Since the mid-1990s, more than 120 countries have carried out one or more Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey, generating data on key indicators on the well-being of children, and helping shape policies for the improvement of their lives.

fields.Project/Product Name: The State of the World’s Children Report
fields.Project Description: Published annually by UNICEF, The State of the World’s Children report is a flagship global publication that presents comprehensive data and analysis on issues affecting children’s well-being. Each edition focuses on a specific theme—such as nutrition, mental health, or education—and includes rigorous data from household surveys, administrative sources, and UNICEF’s global monitoring systems. The report is a key advocacy and programming resource for policymakers and humanitarian actors, offering evidence-based recommendations grounded in global and regional trends.

fields.Project/Product Name: WHO/UNICEF Joint Monitoring Programme for Water Supply, Sanitation and Hygiene (JMP)
fields.Project Description: Tracks access to water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH) using global indicators and household survey data accessible under open access licenses.

UNICEF is the world’s leading source of data on children and maintains databases of hundreds of international valid and comparable indicators. With such a wealth of information available, the Data Warehouse has been designed to allow easy access to those indicators across a range of countries, with some datasets spanning back decades.

fields.Org Description: The University of Southampton's data services focus heavily on clinical research, offered through the Clinical Informatics Research Unit (CIRU). They provide services like clinical trials management, form design, data integration, global health research analysis, and clinical innovation. Their cloud-based clinical trials management system, 'EDGE,' is widely used in the NHS and internationally for managing and tracking studies. Southampton's research also addresses data accessibility, privacy, and technical limitations through data science projects, and they have expertise in the ethical, legal, and social aspects of data (ELSA).

fields.Project Description: Provides standardized global administrative boundary datasets, essential for geospatial analysis and mapping. Open-access and regularly updated, these boundaries support humanitarian planning, statistical frameworks, and international data interoperability.
WorldPop develops peer-reviewed research and methods for the construction of open and high-resolution geospatial data on population distributions, demographic and dynamics.

OCHA’s Common Operational Data Administrative Boundaries (COD‑AB) is a curated, harmonized global dataset aligned with OCHA’s COD standard, designed to support mapping, analysis, and coordination in humanitarian operations.

WorldPop is an interdisciplinary applied research group focusing primarily on supporting improvement of the spatial demographic evidence base and the use of these data for health and development applications, including addressing the Sustainable Development Goals. Its mission is to enable decision makers to harness the power of spatial demographic data through high quality applied research, to achieve a vision of a world where everyone, everywhere is counted in decision making.

fields.Project/Product Name: GRID3: Geo-Referenced Infrastructure and Demographic Data for Development
fields.Project Description: GRID3 provides high-resolution geospatial data—including population estimates, infrastructure mapping, and administrative boundaries—to assist governments and organizations in planning, monitoring, and delivering services effectively.
MAP provides high-resolution maps of malaria risk and stability, combining epidemiological and environmental data to support global health planning, investment, and disease modeling.

WorldPop is an interdisciplinary applied research group focusing primarily on supporting improvement of the spatial demographic evidence base and the use of these data for health and development applications, including addressing the Sustainable Development Goals. Its mission is to enable decision makers to harness the power of spatial demographic data through high quality applied research, to achieve a vision of a world where everyone, everywhere is counted in decision making.

name: WFP: United Nations World Food Programme

fields.Org Full Name: WFP: United Nations World Food Programme
fields.Org Description: We work to enhance nutrition in women and children, support smallholder farmers in improving productivity and reducing losses, help countries and communities prepare for and cope with climate-related shocks, and boost human capital through school feeding programmes.

fields.Agency/Department Name: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ)

fields.Project Description: This dataset contains dekadal rainfall indicators computed from Climate Hazards Group InfraRed Precipitation satellite imagery with insitu Station data (CHIRPS) version 2, aggregated by subnational administrative units

HungerMapLIVE is the World Food Programme (WFP)’s global hunger monitoring system. It combines key metrics from various data sources – such as food security information, weather, population size, conflict, hazards, nutrition information and macro-economic data – to help assess, monitor and predict the magnitude and severity of hunger in near real-time. The resulting analysis is displayed on an interactive map that helps WFP staff, key decision makers and the broader humanitarian community to make more informed and timely decisions relating to food security.

fields.Project/Product Name: Platform for Real-Time Impact and Situation Monitoring (PRISM)
fields.Project Description: PRISM is a climate risk monitoring system that integrates geospatial data on hazards such as droughts, floods, tropical storms, and earthquakes, along with socioeconomic vulnerability information. It provides decision-makers with interactive maps and charts to support disaster risk reduction and social assistance programs

This dataset contains Countries, Commodities and Markets data, sourced from the World Food Programme Price Database. The volume of data means that the actual Food Prices data is in country level datasets. The World Food Programme Price Database covers foods such as maize, rice, beans, fish, and sugar for 98 countries and some 3000 markets. It is updated weekly but contains to a large extent monthly data. The data goes back as far as 1992 for a few countries, although many countries started reporting from 2003 or thereafter.

MSNA is a standardized, country-level data collection initiative that captures multi-sectoral needs in crisis-affected populations. Data collected informs strategic planning, prioritization, and humanitarian response efforts.

fields.Org Description: The Netherlands Red Cross‘ data and digital unit 510 aims to help every National Red Cross and Red Crescent Society in need anywhere. It is named after the total surface area of the earth (510 million square kilometres). 510 started in 2016 with a core team of 3 and never stopped growing. Currently, 510 has more than 100 team members, of whom 70+ are professional volunteers and academic students.
fields.Org Mission: It’s purpose is to improve speed, quality and cost-effectiveness of humanitarian aid by creating products and services using data and digital.

fields.Project Description: The 510 Data Team supports innovation through data science projects targeting disaster preparedness, local early warning, and big data tools across the Red Cross network.

fields.Agency/Department Name: Ministry for Europe and Foreign Affairs (MEAE)
Netherlands – Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands (BZ / MFA)
Ministry of Education, Culture, and Science (OCW)

name: OHCHR: United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights

fields.Org Full Name: OHCHR: United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights
fields.Org Description: The High Commissioner for Human Rights is the principal human rights official of the United Nations. The United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights is accountable to the Secretary-General and is responsible for all the activities of OHCHR, as well as for its administration.

fields.Agency/Department Name: Ministry of Foreign and European Affairs, Defence, Development Cooperation and Foreign Trade
European Union Emergency Trust Fund for Africa (EUTF)

fields.Project Description: The Rapid Assessment Data project accelerates reporting of conflict-related violence in fragile settings by automating data gathering from open and established sources and integrating Machine Learning (ML) driven analysis. Impacts will be enhanced risk assessment, targeted interventions, and empowered at-risk populations able to advocate protective measures.

fields.Org Description: UCLouvain aims to enable those who wish to do so – young people leaving secondary education or adults engaged in professional life – to train and acquire the skills useful for their development and their professional activities.

fields.Project Description: EM‑DAT compiles free, searchable global records of natural and technological disasters dating back to 1900. It provides standardized event-level data used extensively in disaster risk research, policy analysis, and early warning modeling.

fields.Org Description: UNFPA, the United Nations Population Fund, works globally to ensure universal access to sexual and reproductive health, prevent and respond to gender-based violence, collect and use population data, and promote gender equality and the empowerment of women and youth across the humanitarian/development continuum.

fields.Project Description: UNFPA, the United Nations Population Fund, works globally to ensure universal access to sexual and reproductive health, prevent and respond to gender-based violence, collect and use population data, and promote gender equality and the empowerment of women and youth across the humanitarian/development continuum.

The **Population Data Portal** is UNFPA’s ultimate data source and tracker for population and development data. It combines the newest population data on topics like sexual and reproductive health and reproductive rights, family planning, maternal health, or gender based violence gathered from multiple sources.

fields.Project/Product Name: GRID3: Geo-Referenced Infrastructure and Demographic Data for Development
fields.Project Description: GRID3 provides high-resolution geospatial data—including population estimates, infrastructure mapping, and administrative boundaries—to assist governments and organizations in planning, monitoring, and delivering services effectively.

The **World Population Dashboard** showcases global population data, including fertility rate, gender parity in school enrolment, information on sexual and reproductive health, and much more. Together, these data shine a light on the health and rights of people around the world, especially women and young people. The numbers here come from UNFPA and fellow UN agencies, and are updated annually.

fields.Org Description: The Feminist Humanitarian Network (FHN) is a global collective of feminist leaders working together to transform the humanitarian system into one that is guided by feminist principles.
fields.Org Mission: To contribute to transforming the current humanitarian system into an intersectional feminist ecosystem, free of the structural inequalities that drive crises, including racism, patriarchy, colonialism and neoliberalism.

fields.Agency/Department Name: The David and Lucile Packard Foundation

fields.Project/Product Name: Kente Threads: Weaving leadership from displacement data
fields.Project Description: Kente Threads is a feminist initiative that reimagines humanitarian action by centering refugee women’s resilience and lived experiences.

fields.Org Description: UN Women is the United Nations entity dedicated to gender equality and the empowerment of women. A global champion for women and girls, UN Women was established to accelerate progress on meeting their needs worldwide.

fields.Project/Product Name: Transformative Outcomes: Leveraging Crisis Data in conflict
fields.Project Description: The Transformative Outcomes project deploys an interactive web platform and standardized analysis toolkit to deliver high-quality crisis data for vulnerable populations in conflict-affected settings. This promotes evidence-based planning, targeted interventions, and capacity building among local actors, humanitarian agencies, and policymakers. CRAF’d funding supports data collection in six pilot countries, platform development, and training, catalyzing scalable, accessible data as a global public good.

fields.Project Website: not available in mptfo website yet
fields.Project Description: No description yet (website not available)

fields.Org Description: The US Geological Survey maintains extensive data services and conducts numerous data-related projects across various fields, including mapping mineral resources, analyzing global supply chains, and conducting environmental monitoring and research. Projects often involve collaborations with other governmental agencies, universities, and private companies. For example, USGS offers technical assistance internationally, with expertise in areas like seismic monitoring and water resource assessment. Their Community for Data Integration (CDI) supports data-driven research by funding projects that enhance data analysis tools, such as the Terrestrial Remote Sensing Data Ingestion with PyHAT, which facilitates the use of multiple terrestrial datasets for machine learning analysis.

fields.Project Description: USGS systems offering real-time search and visualization of earthquake data, global hazards, and geophysical datasets. They support crisis response and scientific analysis through open APIs.

name: UNODA: United Nations Office for Disarmament Affairs

fields.Org Full Name: UNODA: United Nations Office for Disarmament Affairs
fields.Org Description: UNODA provides substantive and organizational support for norm-setting in the area of disarmament through the work of the General Assembly and its First Committee, the Disarmament Commission, the Conference on Disarmament and other bodies. It fosters disarmament measures through dialogue, transparency and confidence-building on military matters, and encourages regional disarmament efforts; these include the United Nations Register of Conventional Arms and regional forums.

fields.Project Description: The UN General Assembly established the UN Register of Conventional Arms (UNROCA) in 1991 through resolution 46/36 L to promote transparency in armaments. Through the UNROCA instrument, Member States are requested, on an annual basis, to report their international transfers of seven categories major conventional arms, as well as small arms and light weapons. They may also provide additional background information, such as data on military holdings and procurement through national production. To date, 175 Member States have reported to the UNROCA instrument at least once. In light of relatively consistent reporting by the world’s largest arms exporters, it is estimated that the Register captures around 90 percent of the volume of the global arms trade.

fields.Project/Product Name: United Nations Report on Military Expenditures (UNMilEx)
fields.Project Description: UNODA publishes annual data on military spending from Member States, informing arms control and global transparency through structured datasets.

fields.Org Description: The Open Data Cube (ODC) is a free, open-source software package that simplifies the management and analysis of large amounts of satellite imagery and other Earth observation data.

fields.Project Description: Open Data Cube is an open-source geospatial data platform designed to manage, analyze, and visualize large volumes of satellite Earth observation data. It provides tools for governments and researchers to turn raw imagery into actionable environmental insights.

fields.Org Description: An independent research organisation providing evidence and policy advice to inform better humanitarian action.

fields.Project Description: GDHO is a global compendium of organisations that provide aid in humanitarian crises. The database includes basic organisational and operational information on these humanitarian providers, which include international non-governmental organisations (grouped by federation), national NGOs that deliver aid within their own borders, UN humanitarian agencies, and the International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement.

CORE is the latest data-driven initiative by Humanitarian Outcomes to provide quantifiable measures on the size of the humanitarian sector as well as its capacity and reach in crisis-affected countries.

The Aid Worker Security Database (AWSD) records major incidents of violence against aid workers, with incident reports from 1997 through the present. Initiated in 2005, to date the AWSD remains the sole comprehensive global source of these data, providing the evidence base for analysis of the changing security environment for civilian aid operations.

fields.Org Description: UNDP works in about 170 countries and territories, helping to eradicate poverty, reduce inequalities and exclusion, and build resilience so countries can sustain progress. As the UN’s development agency, UNDP plays a critical role in helping countries achieve the Sustainable Development Goals.

fields.Agency/Department Name: Ministry of Foreign and European Affairs, Defence, Development Cooperation and Foreign Trade

fields.Project Description:
The Risk Anticipation Data Hub, a project of the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP), is a transformative open-access data platform. A ready-to-use data warehouse for over 15,000 indicators combines processed and cleaned public datasets on a multitude of risk factors. Equipped with state-of-the-art technology, including a generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) interface and real-time analytics, the Data Hub empowers ecosystem partners with data and insights for better crisis anticipation, prevention, and response. 
**<https://sdgintegration.undp.org/crisis-risk-dashboard>**

[INFORM Warning](https://drmkc.jrc.ec.europa.eu/inform-index/INFORM-Warning) is a state-of-the-art innovative global risk monitoring tool designed to anticipate complex risks up to a year in advance, directly linked to crisis funding instruments. It transcends traditional methods by presenting multi-hazard information from diverse sources. Its unique analysis offers insights into risk trends, forecasts, scenarios, and potential events leading to crisis impact.
A toolkit of open-source principles and guidelines aimed at helping UNDP and partners design interoperable, user-centered digital solutions.

fields.Org Description: The Centre for Humanitarian Data is focused on increasing the use and impact of data in the humanitarian sector. It is managed by the United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA). As part of OCHA’s Information Management Branch, the Centre’s role is to enable the organization to deliver on its ambition to be more data-driven and analytical, and to ensure a responsible approach to technology and data management.

fields.Project Description: **HXL** is a simple standard for messy data. Use HXL hashtags to speed up data processing and create interoperability across data sources.

Managed by the United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), the Humanitarian Data Exchange (HDX) is a centralized platform for sharing humanitarian data. It offers access to over 20,000 datasets from more than 300 organizations, covering themes such as population, conflict, health, and displacement. HDX includes the Data Grid and the COVID-19 Data Explorer, and it plays a crucial role in promoting data transparency, interoperability, and informed decision-making in humanitarian settings.

The initial scope of HDX HAPI mirrored that of the HDX Data Grids, which include the foundational data needed to understand a humanitarian context. However we have since expanded beyond the Data Grids, and a live dashboard of data availability by country can be found at <https://ocha-dap.github.io/viz-hapi-availability/>.

name: FSNWG: Food Security and Nutrition Working Group

fields.Org Full Name: FSNWG: Food Security and Nutrition Working Group
fields.Org Description: The Food Security and Nutrition Working Group (FSNWG) is a regional platform, currently co-chaired by ICPAC and FAO. It’s goal is two-fold: to provide an up-to-date food security and nutrition situation analysis (early warning) and to offer a forum to build consensus on critical issues facing policy and interventions. The FNSWG has served regional governments, donors, and non-governmental agencies since the early 2000’s. Current membership includes approximately 80 organisations (IGAD, UN agencies, NGOs, donors, and research institutions) who contribute to the operation of the working group, and its nutrition, markets, food security information, livestock and pastoralist sub-groups.

fields.Org Description: The United Nations Satellite Centre (UNOSAT), part of UNITAR, delivers satellite analysis, training, and capacity development to UN entities and Member States. We leverage geospatial technologies to support humanitarian response, sustainable development, and resilience building worldwide.

fields.Project/Product Name: Global Disaster Alert and Coordination System (GDACS)
fields.Project Description: GDACS is a cooperation framework between the United Nations, the European Commission and disaster managers worldwide to improve alerts, information exchange and coordination in the first phase after major sudden-onset disasters.

fields.Org Description: Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) is a leading scientific innovator of global risk reduction science and technology. As a University of Hawai’i applied science and research center, our work intersects with a variety of government, community, academic, and scientific organizations at home and around the world to build resilience to natural and man-made hazards, assess risk, and enhance the capacity to quickly and accurately anticipate and prepare for new and emerging threats.

fields.Project Description: DisasterAWARE is a global platform offering real-time hazard alerts, dashboards, and geospatial tools for disaster preparedness and early warning. It integrates predictive models and hazard tracking from global datasets.

fields.Org Description: Uppsala University is the oldest Nordic university, founded in 1477. Today we are a comprehensive research university with a clear mission: to pursue top-quality research and education and to interact constructively with society, thus contributing to a better world.

fields.Project/Product Name: Violence and Impact Early Warning System–People In Need (VIEWS-PIN)
fields.Project Description: Set at an extension to the world-leading conflict prediction system [VIEWS](https://viewsforecasting.org/), VIEWS-PIN will provide monthly worldwide forecasts for the number of people in need of humanitarian assistance following exposure to conflict. Defining need as adverse changes in average income, access to water, healthcare, education, and food, VIEWS-PIN will also provide forecasts for each of these five dimensions to facilitate targeted action.
UCDP offers conflict datasets, battle event data, and fatalities statistics to support academic and policy research on global violence trends.

fields.Org Description: SIPRI is an independent international institute dedicated to research into conflict, armaments, arms control and disarmament. Established in 1966, SIPRI provides data, analysis and recommendations, based on open sources, to policymakers, researchers, media and the interested public. Based in Stockholm, SIPRI is regularly ranked among the most respected think tanks worldwide.

This database tracks country participation in UN and regional peace operations—including troop numbers, funding, and deployment dates.

fields.Project Description: Tracks international arms transfer assistance and cooperation initiatives. It supports transparency and reporting under the Arms Trade Treaty through searchable data.

The SIPRI National Budget Archive offers government spending data across countries, enabling transparent comparison of military and civilian budget priorities to support disarmament and peacebuilding analysis.

name: UNMAS: United Nations Mine Action Service

fields.Org Full Name: UNMAS: United Nations Mine Action Service
fields.Org Description: UNMAS (United Nations Mine Action Service) utilizes data to inform and manage mine action programs globally, coordinating with other UN entities and partners. They maintain an Interactive Dashboard of the UN Mine Action Strategy, which presents data on program outcomes, outputs, targeted populations, and funding. UNMAS also collaborates on data-related projects, including a machine learning initiative to detect development indicators in cleared areas of Afghanistan using satellite imagery, which informs their efforts to eliminate the threat of mines and explosives.

fields.Agency/Department Name: Ministry of Foreign and European Affairs, Defence, Development Cooperation and Foreign Trade

fields.Org Description: The University of San Francisco Quito (USFQ) incorporates data services and projects within its academic and research endeavors, particularly through programs like the Data Science major, which combines mathematics, statistics, and computer science to equip students with data analysis and machine learning skills. Projects include building data pipelines for text-to-image and image-to-image semantic search using various technologies and developing solutions for unstructured data extraction.

fields.Project Description: **The Institute of Geography of the USFQ** has been created to generate scientific knowledge of the environmental, socioeconomic and biophysical processes that occur in the Ecuadorian territory. Thus, it creates relevant evidence for public policies, individual and social action for the conservation of ecosystems and well-being of populations.

fields.Org Description: Flowminder also co-founded, in partnership with UNFPA, WorldPop at the University of Southampton, and CIESIN at Columbia University the GRID3 programme. GRID3 was an international partnership programme funded by the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation and the United Kingdom’s Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office to map a path to sustainable development for everyone with geospatial data solutions.

fields.Org Mission:

INSO's mission is to support humanitarian safety and access in high-risk countries.

fields.Project Description: The Global Exposure Database (GED) is a spatial dataset created by GEM that quantifies the exposure of buildings and infrastructure to natural hazards across countries. It includes structural typologies, occupancy data, and geographic distributions, enabling users to estimate potential losses from earthquakes and other disasters. GED is openly available and widely used in conjunction with hazard models to inform national disaster risk management strategies and build resilience in urban development planning.

Developed by the Global Earthquake Model (GEM) Foundation, the OpenQuake Platform is an open-source tool for seismic hazard and risk assessment. It provides researchers, engineers, and governments with models, tools, and databases to simulate earthquake impacts, assess vulnerability, and inform urban planning and disaster preparedness strategies. OpenQuake integrates data on seismicity, exposure, and building fragility, and is widely used in both academic research and national risk management initiatives.

The Global Seismic Hazard Map (GSHM), developed under the auspices of the Global Earthquake Model (GEM), provides probabilistic assessments of earthquake hazards worldwide. It combines global seismicity data, geological models, and ground motion prediction equations to estimate the likelihood of earthquake-induced ground shaking. GSHM supports disaster risk reduction, urban planning, and insurance risk modeling by offering a harmonized and peer-reviewed reference for national and regional seismic hazard assessments.

fields.Org Description: Focus on having data ready before the occurrence of a disaster, thereby saving lives through preparedness and efficient response.

fields.Project Description: In the daily whirlwind, we often underestimate the data avalanche we create. But there's a golden opportunity – standardize and organize. This unlocks lessons from the past, supercharges efficiency, and fuels brilliant strategic decisions.
At the heart of every humanitarian mission lies the critical 3Ws - _Who is doing what and where._
This platform offers a consolidated dataset on local organizations, presenting a 3W map (Who does What, Where) that details the operational presence of both national and international organizations.

Embracing a grassroots ethos, we forge vital connections on the frontline. Before diving into data collection, we scour the digital realm, unearthing existing efforts to eliminate redundancy. Then, we fuse these online insights with raw field data, thanks to our trusted local partners.

fields.Org Description: MapSwipe is a humanitarian crowdsourcing app where volunteers swipe through satellite images to help map vulnerable areas that aid organizations rely on.

fields.Project Description: MapSwipe coordinates volunteer mapping of satellite imagery to create open building and infrastructure datasets in underserved areas. It supports crisis mapping, response planning, and humanitarian targeting.

name: DRC: Danish Refugee Council

fields.Org Description: Founded in 1956, the Danish Refugee Council (DRC) is Denmark’s largest international NGO, with a specific expertise in forced displacement. DRC is present in close to 40 countries. DRC advocates for the rights of and solutions for displacement-affected communities, and provides assistance during all stages of displacement: In acute crisis, in exile, when settling and integrating in a new place, or upon return. DRC supports displaced persons in becoming self-reliant and included into hosting societies. DRC works with civil society and responsible authorities to promote protection of rights and inclusion.

fields.Org Description: REACH is a leading humanitarian initiative providing granular data, timely information and in-depth analysis from contexts of crisis, disaster and displacement. The work of REACH directly feeds into aid response and decision-making by providing accessible and precise information on the humanitarian situation of crisis-affected populations.

fields.Project Description: The Resource Centre provides open-access tools, maps, and datasets to support humanitarian needs analysis and tools like MSNA and JMCNA, enabling evidence-based decision-making during crises.

MSNA is a standardized, country-level data collection initiative that captures multi-sectoral needs in crisis-affected populations. Data collected informs strategic planning, prioritization, and humanitarian response efforts.

name: UNDPPA: United Nations Department of Political and Peacebuilding Affairs

fields.Org Full Name: UNDPPA: United Nations Department of Political and Peacebuilding Affairs
fields.Org Description: The Department of Political and Peacebuilding Affairs (DPPA) plays a central role in United Nations efforts to prevent and resolve conflict around the world. DPPA supports the Secretary-General’s peace initiatives, oversees mediation, political transition and peacebuilding processes, and assists UN Member States as they carry out elections.

fields.Project Description: The DPPA Innovation Cell pilots digital tools—including AI, data visualization, and social media analysis—to support conflict prevention, early warning, and diplomacy efforts in fragile contexts.

Developed by the DPPA’s [Innovation Cell](https://futuringpeace.org/) in collaboration with academic partners, Geoguard is the first-ever geospatial dashboard for decision-makers with insight on environmental and conflict risks across the Middle East, Central, and West Africa. Using cutting-edge technology, Geoguard aggregates millions of data points on environmental conditions and geo-coded conflict events in an intuitive dashboard, using diverse data sources and locally collected or crowd-sourced information. It provides immediate insight on environmental risk-factors throughout specified regions and snapshots in time linked to trends in conflict and social unrest.

fields.Org Description: The United States Agency for International Development is an independent agency of the United States government responsible for administering civilian foreign aid and development assistance.
fields.Org IATI Name: United States Agency for International Development (USAID)

fields.Project/Product Name: Famine Early Warning Systems Network (FEWS NET)
fields.Project Description: FEWS NET issues monthly and event-driven food insecurity forecasts based on integrated climate, socioeconomic, and agricultural data. Its publicly shared maps and data support anticipatory humanitarian planning and funding allocation in high-risk areas.

name: HOT: Humanitarian Open Street Map Team

fields.Org Full Name: HOT: Humanitarian Open Street Map Team
fields.Org Description: HOT is an international team dedicated to humanitarian action and community development through open mapping. We work together to provide map data which revolutionises disaster management, reduces risks, and contributes to achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals.
fields.Org Mission: Reaching those in need through maps

fields.Project Description: Managed by the Humanitarian OpenStreetMap Team, FMTM coordinates mapping campaigns in crisis zones through volunteer contributions. It organizes tasks, quality controls labeling, and integrates open geospatial datasets into humanitarian operational platforms.

HOT is an international team dedicated to humanitarian action and community development through open mapping. We work together to provide map data which revolutionises disaster management, reduces risks, and contributes to achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals.

fields.Org Description: QGIS, also known as Quantum Geographic Information System, is a free and open-source Geographic Information System (GIS) software. It allows users to create, edit, visualize, analyze, and publish geospatial information. QGIS supports various data formats and is widely used for mapping and spatial analysis tasks.

fields.Project Description: QGIS is a free, open-source geographic information system (GIS) application used worldwide for mapping, spatial analysis, and geostatistical modeling. It supports both raster and vector data and is widely adopted by humanitarian, environmental, and development actors.

name: ACLED: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data

fields.Org Full Name: ACLED: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data
fields.Org Description: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data (ACLED) is a disaggregated data collection, analysis, and crisis mapping initiative. ACLED collects information on the dates, actors, locations, fatalities, and types of all reported political violence and protest events around the world. The ACLED team conducts analysis to describe and explore conflict trends.
fields.Org Mission: Our mission is to provide accurate and accessible data and analysis to better inform decisions that reduce violent conflict.

fields.Project Description: ACLED is a widely used conflict dataset that tracks the locations, dates, actors, and types of political violence and protest events across the world. Updated weekly, it covers over 150 countries and includes data on battles, riots, strategic developments, and civilian targeting. ACLED’s open-access data and analytical tools are used by policymakers, researchers, and humanitarian organizations to monitor conflict dynamics, assess risk, and support early warning systems and humanitarian planning.
The ACLED Conflict Alert System (CAST) is a conflict forecasting visualization platform that predicts political violence events up to six months in the future for every country in the world.

ACLED Trendfinder offers an array of interconnected tools for tracking patterns of political violence and protest. Using the visualization platform, you can identify important changes in political violence and protest across and within countries, situate this activity within historical contexts, and spot early warning signs.
The Conflict Monitors cover key areas and can support conflict analysis, violence-prevention initiatives, and efforts to monitor emerging crisis situations.

The Conflict Exposure Calculator integrates data from ACLED with population size estimates from WorldPop, to estimate the civilian impact by proximity to an event, event type, type of violent actor or specific armed group, location, and time.

fields.Org Description: IMPACT’s PANDA initiative aims to improve the effectiveness, efficiency and efficacy of humanitarian and development interventions. PANDA supports the entire humanitarian programme cycle, including programme design, assessments, baselines, monitoring and evaluation.

fields.Project Description: IMPACT’s PANDA initiative aims to improve the effectiveness, efficiency and efficacy of humanitarian and development interventions. PANDA supports the entire humanitarian programme cycle, including programme design, assessments, baselines, monitoring and evaluation.

name: The Demographic and Health Survey (DHS Program)

fields.Org Full Name: The Demographic and Health Survey (DHS Program)
fields.Org Description: The DHS Program (Demographic and Health Surveys) is a primary source of data on health and population trends in developing countries, having provided technical assistance to over 300 surveys in more than 90 countries since 1984. They collect and disseminate nationally representative data on critical areas including fertility, family planning, maternal and child health, gender, HIV/AIDS, malaria, and nutrition. Funded by USAID and other donors, and implemented by ICF International, The DHS Program plays a vital role in advancing global understanding of health and population issues.

Data Friendly Space (DFS) provides trustworthy digital tools and actionable data for social impact organisations to fulfil their mission. We believe that the international community holds not just the knowledge, but also the responsibility to utilise emerging technologies and data to better prepare for and respond to humanitarian needs, support the achievement of Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), and accelerate climate action.

fields.Project Description: GANNET is a real-time, end-to-end Generative AI platforms that combine near real-time assistance, analytics, and monitoring features for humanitarian data collaboration and effective decision-making.

fields.Project Description: This Observatory provides updated information on the killing of journalists since 1993 and on the [judicial status of condemned cases](https://www.unesco.org/en/safety-journalists/observatory/methodology?hub=72609) since 2006. It also provides [public access to country responses](https://unesdoc.unesco.org/permalink/P-3516a4e6-b69d-473a-8e85-b019735aa873) to UNESCO's requests for information into the judicial status of ongoing and unresolved cases. You may browse the [full list of killed journalists](https://www.unesco.org/safety-journalists/observatory/grid?hub=72609) and search for [visual statistics and data](https://www.unesco.org/safety-journalists/observatory/statistics?hub=72609).

fields.Project Description: The [List of World Heritage in Danger](https://whc.unesco.org/en/danger-list/) is designed to inform the international community of conditions which threaten the very characteristics for which a property was inscribed on the World Heritage List, and to encourage corrective action.
UIS is UNESCO's global statistical agency for education, science, culture, and communication—publishing SDG indicators and open data in standardized formats.

UNESCO’s platform delivers open access data on emergency-affected education systems—including enrollment, disruptions, and inclusion metrics—supporting global response planning in crises and displacement settings.

fields.Org Description: We are a non-profit organisation collaborating with partners around the world to prepare for and respond to humanitarian emergencies. We strive to ensure global, regional, national and local disaster management and humanitarian agencies have access to the maps, visualised data, information and analysis that they need to make key decisions, at the right times, to save lives and reduce suffering.

name: ICG: International Crisis Group

fields.Org Description:
The International Crisis Group is an independent organisation working to prevent wars and shape policies that will build a more peaceful world.
Crisis Group sounds the alarm to prevent deadly conflict. We build support for the good governance and inclusive politics that enable societies to flourish. We engage directly with a range of conflict actors to seek and share information, and to encourage intelligent action for peace.

fields.Project Description: CrisisWatch is our global conflict tracker, an early warning tool designed to help prevent deadly violence. It keeps decision-makers up-to-date with developments in over 70 conflicts and crises every month, identifying trends and alerting them to risks of escalation and opportunities to advance peace. In addition, CrisisWatch monitors over 50 situations (“standby monitoring”) to offer timely information if developments indicate a drift toward violence or instability. Entries dating back to 2003 provide easily searchable conflict histories

fields.Agency/Department Name: European Union Emergency Trust Fund for Africa (EUTF)

fields.Country Name: Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

fields.Project Description: Developed by the [International Crisis Group](https://www.crisisgroup.org/), EEARTH is a revolutionary early warning system designed to identify climate-driven conflict pathways in the Horn of Africa. By integrating both quantitative and qualitative data, it offers a comprehensive approach to climate-security risks. Initially piloted in Somalia and South Sudan, EEARTH provides insights into the underlying causes of conflict risks. Its innovative approach is geared towards anticipating, preventing, and addressing the repercussions of climate-related security threats.

donor_countries: Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

fields.Org Description: The UN Foundation facilitates data and technology initiatives to support sustainable development by convening UN agencies, governments, civil society, academics, and the private sector. They host and support partnerships like the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development Data, which uses data to achieve the Sustainable Development Goals, and DIAL, which aims to overcome barriers preventing digital solutions from reaching everyone. They also support Data2X, a gender data alliance working to improve the quality, availability, and use of gender data to make a practical difference in the lives of women, girls, and gender-diverse people worldwide.

fields.Project Description: Data2X is a global partnership advancing gender-responsive data systems. It builds research, advocacy, and tools to support data on women and girls, including capacity strengthening and innovation grants.

fields.Org Description: Arab Barometer is a nonpartisan research network that provides insight into the social, political, and economic attitudes and values of ordinary citizens across the Arab world. We have been conducting high quality and reliable public opinion surveys in the Middle East and North Africa since 2006. We are the longest-standing and the largest repository of publicly available data on the views of men and women in the MENA region. Our findings give a voice to the needs and concerns of Arab publics.

fields.Project Description: The Arab Pulse was founded in 2018 to provide an outlet for political discussion on the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) based on quantitative research. The MENA region is in constant flux and faces new and old challenges. The Arab Pulse represents a central nexus for empirical and data driven research focused on contemporary MENA politics, society, and values engaging scholars, policy makers, and the media from the region and beyond

Our data analysis tool allows researchers, who have no access to statistical software packages, to conduct simple descriptive analysis of all Arab Barometer waves and countries. All results can be downloaded in various different formats and can be integrated into reports, articles, and presentations.
Provides harmonized survey data covering public opinion on governance, religion, and economics in 20+ Arab countries. Data is freely accessible and supports comparative analysis across the region.

name: IFRC: International Federation of the Red Cross and Red Crescent

fields.Org Full Name: IFRC: International Federation of the Red Cross and Red Crescent
fields.Org Description: The International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC) is the world's largest humanitarian organization, with 190 member National Societies. As part of the International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement, our work is guided by seven fundamental principles; humanity, impartiality, neutrality, independence, voluntary service, unity and universality.
fields.Org IATI Name: International Federation of the Red Cross and Red Crescent (IFRC)

fields.Agency/Department Name: Agencia Vasca de Cooperación para el Desarrollo / eLankidetza
Ministry for Europe and Foreign Affairs (MEAE)

fields.Project Description: The IFRC Global Disaster Preparedness Center, together with the Red Cross Red Crescent Climate Centre and American Red Cross, develops data-driven tools and best practice templates. The center enables early warning preparedness and resilience building through open guides, scenario modeling tools, and dashboards.

**Trigger models are employed to establish danger levels that activate humanitarian anticipatory Early Action Protocols (EAPs). **These models are developed using the Impact-Based Forecasting ([IBF](https://510.global/glossary/ibf/)) methodology. So far, we have built models that trigger EAPs for typhoon, flood, dzud, drought and dengue hazards.

Trigger models are employed to establish danger levels that activate humanitarian anticipatory Early Action Protocols (EAPs). These models are developed using the Impact-Based Forecasting ([IBF](https://510.global/glossary/ibf/)) methodology. So far, we have built models that trigger EAPs for typhoon, flood, dzud, drought and dengue hazards.

PHASI® is a data integration and analysis platform developed by the American Red Cross that aggregates multi-sectoral indicators to identify public health and safety risks. It supports disaster planning, resource allocation, and early warning efforts.

fields.Org Description: The Joint Research Centre (JRC) is the European Commission's science and knowledge service which employs scientists to carry out research in order to provide independent scientific advice and support to European Union (EU) policy.

fields.Project/Product Name: Global Disaster Alert and Coordination System (GDACS)
fields.Project Description: GDACS is a cooperation framework between the United Nations, the European Commission and disaster managers worldwide to improve alerts, information exchange and coordination in the first phase after major sudden-onset disasters.

INFORM Climate Change Risk Index is an upgrade of INFORM Risk Index as it includes climate and socio-economic projections. It provides quantified estimates of the impacts of climate change on the future risk of humanitarian crises and disasters. The results are intended to inform policy choices across climate mitigation, climate adaptation, disaster risk reduction, sustainable development and humanitarian assistance.

EIOS is a real-time platform developed by WHO and the European Commission to collect, verify, and share public health threat information from open sources. It offers a centralized dashboard and alerting system to help health agencies monitor emerging epidemics and coordinate responses.

GloFAS, developed by EC-JRC and ECMWF, provides open-access flood forecasts and risk assessments. It integrates global hydrological models to support early warning systems and flood preparedness planning.

The INFORM Risk Index is a multi-hazard risk assessment tool developed by the Inter-Agency Standing Committee (IASC) and the European Commission. It combines data on hazards, vulnerability, and coping capacity to produce a composite score of disaster risk in over 190 countries. The index supports evidence-based disaster preparedness, humanitarian planning, and crisis response by identifying countries most at risk of crises that could overwhelm national response capacities. It is updated annually and incorporates more than 50 indicators.

name: UNCCD: United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification

fields.Org Full Name: UNCCD: United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification
fields.Org Description: The UNCCD is the global voice for land. We promote practices that avoid, reduce and reverse land degradation and are the driving force behind Sustainable Development Goal 15 and Land Degradation Neutrality.

The World Meteorological Organization fosters the international exchange and standardization of meteorological and hydrological data, crucial for weather forecasting, climate monitoring, and water resource management. Their World Climate Data and Monitoring Programme (WCDMP) coordinates climate data and assessment, while initiatives like data rescue projects, including the MEditerranean climate DAta REscue (MEDARE) project and the International Environmental Data Rescue Organization (IEDRO), work to digitize historical data for research and analysis. The WMO also implements the WMO Hydrological Observing System (WHOS) through the WMO HydroHub to facilitate data sharing and capacity building in hydrology.

fields.Project Description: WWIS is a centralized WMO platform delivering authoritative city-level weather forecasts and climate summaries sourced from national meteorological and hydrological services. It supports risk awareness and decision-making through free, real-time access to standardized global weather data.

name: UNDRR: United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction

fields.Org Full Name: UNDRR: United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction
fields.Org Description:
The United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction (UNDRR) has a big ambition: to help decision makers across the globe better understand and act on risk. 
At UNDRR, we envision a world where disasters no longer threaten the well-being of people and the future of the planet. Sustainable development and the 2030 Agenda cannot be achieved without working towards that goal of building resilience.

fields.Agency/Department Name: Ministry of Foreign and European Affairs, Defence, Development Cooperation and Foreign Trade

fields.Project Description: Datum is a centralized portal offering free, open-access databases and RESTful APIs designed to support disaster risk reduction (DRR) efforts worldwide. All datasets and metadata can be downloaded or queried under UNDRR’s terms, provided proper attribution. The content spans several thematic “data clusters,” each versioned and paginated for easy integration.

PreventionWeb is UNDRR’s global knowledge hub for disaster risk reduction, offering open-access content including research, policy documents, country profiles, and event listings. It provides curated data and analysis tools to help stakeholders stay informed, share practices, and support evidence-based DRR policy and programming.

name: UNHCR: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees

fields.Org Full Name: UNHCR: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees
fields.Org Description:
UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, is a global organization dedicated to saving lives, protecting rights and building a better future for people forced to flee their homes because of conflict and persecution. 
We lead international action to protect refugees, forcibly displaced communities and stateless people.
fields.Org IATI Name: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

fields.Agency/Department Name: European Union Emergency Trust Fund for Africa (EUTF)
Ministry of Foreign and European Affairs, Defence, Development Cooperation and Foreign Trade

fields.Project Description: UNHCR’s MSNA platform collects standardized multi-sector needs data in refugee settings—covering shelter, protection, livelihood, and health metrics to guide program planning and coordination.

fields.Project/Product Name: WASH Knowledge, Attitudes and Practices (KAP) Survey
fields.Project Description: Routine monitoring of the WASH services provided is paramount for quality assurance, ensuring the set standards are met within stipulated timelines, challenges are identified in time and solutions are sought. UNHCR (Cox’s Bazar Field Office) conducted the third round of its WASH Knowledge, Attitude and Practice (KAP) survey from 15th to 23rd November 2023 in UNHCR’s area of operation in Kutupalong and Teknaf. Five WASH partners implemented the survey.

​The UNHCR Global Data Service (GDS) is a central hub for data and statistics on refugees, asylum-seekers, internally displaced persons (IDPs), and stateless individuals.It supports evidence-based decision-making, policy development, and humanitarian operations by providing access to a wide range of data tools and resources.​

The database contains information about forcibly displaced populations spanning more than 70 years of statistical activities. It covers displaced populations such as refugees, asylum-seekers and internally displaced people, including their demographics. Stateless people are also included, most of who have never been displaced. The database also reflects the different types of solutions for displaced populations such as repatriation or resettlement.

<https://github.com/PopulationStatistics/refugees>

This report presents UNHCR’s engagement in multi-sectoral joint needs assessments in 2020 in line with Grand Bargain commitments towards improved harmonization and coordination of assessment exercises as well as increased transparency

The UNHCR Statistical Online Population Database summarizes changes in global trends and levels of the population of concern to UNHCR: refugees, asylum-seekers, returned refugees, internally displaced persons (IDPs) protected/assisted by UNHCR, returned IDPs, stateless persons, and others of concern to UNHCR. The information, reported by UNHCR country offices, generally reflects the data of the host country.

fields.Project/Product Name: World Bank-UNHCR Joint Data Center on Forced Displacement
fields.Project Description: The JDC is a joint initiative to improve the collection, analysis, and use of data on forcibly displaced populations. It provides public goods—surveys, microdata, and research—focused on informing development and humanitarian action through evidence-based approaches.

The Operational Data Portal (ODP) enables UNHCR’s institutional responsibility to provide an information and data sharing platform to facilitate coordination of refugee emergencies. This was achieved using independent ‘situation views’ covering major emergencies such as the Syria situation or the Central African Republic emergency, among others
An archive of anonymized survey and refugee data available under open-access licenses. It supports demographic and displacement research across global contexts.

UNHCR’s case management and registration system manages refugee and asylum-seeker data. The platform supports operational planning, registration, and data interoperability across protection and assistance programs.

RAIS is a digital system for monitoring and coordinating assistance in refugee operations. It supports operations by registering aid delivery and tracking service provision across displacement contexts.

fields.Project/Product Name: Population Registration and Identity Management EcoSystem (PRIMES)
fields.Project Description:
At the center of UNHCR’s work with registration and identity management, lies PRIMES, UNHCR’s digital Population Registration and Identity Management Ecosystem. PRIMES brings together all of UNHCR’s digital registration, identity management and case management tools into one internally connected and interoperable ecosystem.
PRIMES is comprised of several repositories for personal data (biographic and biometric) and supporting information, along with multiple tools which safely make use of the data to deliver targeted protection, assistance, and solutions to refugees and other displaced populations. PRIMES is an enabler for:
- Identity management (including registration and biometric enrolment) and documentation
- Case management (including the principal Protection aspects: Refugee Status Determination, Resettlement, Statelessness, Repatriation, Legal and Physical Protection, Child Protection, SGBV and others)
- Assistance ([cash](https://www.unhcr.org/us/what-we-do/emergency-response/cash-based-interventions) and in-kind)
- Data management, including reporting and analysis for evidence-informed action for quality protection outcomes
PRIMES has been designed with cooperation and interoperability in mind so that refugee supporting governments and partners can make use of the data and technology which UNHCR has developed to enhance their ability to deliver services often together with UNHCR, in a safe and secure manner. PRIMES is fully aligned with the [Policy on the Protection of Personal Data of Persons of Concern to UNHCR](http://www.refworld.org/cgi-bin/texis/vtx/rwmain?page=search&docid=55643c1d4).

The 2024 Socio-Economic Insights Survey (SEIS) in Estonia provides a comprehensive assessment of the needs and vulnerabilities of refugees from Ukraine. Conducted as part of an annual interagency regional process led by UNHCR, this assessment supports the Regional Refugee Response Plan (RRP) for the Ukraine Situation. Covering topics such as protection, health, education, shelter, livelihoods, and food security, the survey offers critical data to inform evidence-based planning and prioritization, ensuring the specific needs of different refugee groups are addressed. Data collection was conducted through face-to-face interviews from May to July 2024 with a probability-based random sample of refugee households, managed collaboratively by UNHCR and the International Organization for Migration. Findings will guide strategic interventions and resource allocation to enhance the welfare and resilience of the refugee population in Estonia.

CLIFDEW-GRID, developed by UNHCR in collaboration with the University of California Irvine, is an ambitious initiative dedicated to addressing the complex challenge of climate-induced forced displacement, including through the first risk index of its kind. This project leverages advanced data analytics and innovative approaches to empower CRAF’d ecosystem partners to anticipate and respond effectively to the growing crisis of climate-induced displacement. By forecasting subnational granularity, the project will better accommodate in-country heterogeneity than traditional country-level approaches. It will be piloted for countries in Western and Eastern Africa. 

<https://www.unhcr.org/us/clifdew-grid>
CLIFDEW-GRID is an early warning grid-based modelling system designed to predict potential climate-induced forced displacement. It is a joint innovative data project led by UNHCR and the [University of California Irvine](https://catalogue.uci.edu/schoolofphysicalsciences/departmentofearthsystemscience/) and financed by the Complex Risk Analytics Fund ([CRAF'd](https://crafd.io/data-financing/clifdewgrid)).

ASR monitors the demographic and socioeconomic profiles of refugee populations worldwide. Its standardized surveys and data visualizations support evidence-based protection, education, and livelihood programming.

fields.Org Description: 3iS’s mission is to empower and enhance the understanding of information through innovative technology, successfully driving strategic change and transforming decision-making. We use data and cutting-edge technology to generate knowledge that equips leaders and change agents to better achieve their objectives in the humanitarian, development, and academic sectors.

fields.Agency/Department Name: Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC)
Directorate-General for European Civil Protection and Humanitarian Aid Operations (DG ECHO)

fields.Project Description: We are at the forefront of leveraging Artificial Intelligence (AI) as a foundational tool in our core services to transform humanitarian response and environmental management. Our commitment to innovation and social impact has earned significant recognition from leading technology partners. We are proud to announce our participation in key initiatives designed to amplify our reach and capabilities:
Our approach focuses on optimizing data collection, analysis, and dissemination of information to enable transparent communication and cooperation between stakeholders.

We support monitoring and evaluation (M&E) activities, which are fundamental to understanding impact, ensuring transparency, and fostering continuous improvements to projects.  
Our goal is to deliver customized, robust frameworks and methodologies specifically designed to capture our partners’ initiatives. We believe that the most effective M&E processes are continuous and should be integrated throughout the project wherever feasible.  
This approach not only ensures ongoing tracking of progress but transparently communicates the impact of the project to both donors and the communities that we support.

Our goal is to empower and equip organizations with the knowledge, skill sets, and tools needed to overcome challenges, enabling them to respond more effectively now and better sustain that success going forward.  
We create both in-person and remote learning environments that foster continuous improvement and innovation, ensuring partners are always growing and adapting to change.

We provide a suite of services that ensure your work is targeted and effective, allowing you to plan strategically, implement operations efficiently, and adapt proactively to the dynamic and changing situations. 
Our goal is to implement efficient systems that optimize operations, allowing partners to work smarter, not harder. This includes, but is not limited to, the development and integration of technology, which enhances efficiency, scalability, and communication. By streaming processes, we help reduce operational costs and help pave the way for sustainable impact.

fields.Org Description:
Afrobarometer, a non-profit company limited by guarantee with headquarters in Ghana, is a pan-African, non-partisan survey research network that conducts public attitude surveys on democracy, governance, the economy, and society. Afrobarometer is the world’s leading source of high-quality data on what Africans are thinking.

The Afrobarometer network encompasses more than 30 national partners responsible for data collection, analysis, and in-country dissemination of findings. Regional coordination is provided by the Ghana Center for Democratic Development (CDD-Ghana), the Institute for Justice and Reconciliation (IJR) in South Africa, and the Institute for Development Studies (IDS) at the University of Nairobi in Kenya. Michigan State University (MSU) and the University of Cape Town (UCT) provide technical support to the network.
fields.Org Mission:
To make citizen voice a key pillar of African policy and decision making
A world in which Africa’s development is anchored in the realities and aspirations of its people

fields.Project Description: Afrobarometer is a pan-African public-opinion research network providing survey insights into democracy, governance, and economic conditions. Survey microdata and analysis tools are publicly available via an open-access portal.

Our online data analysis (ODA) tool is a free and easy way to find, analyse, and use high-quality data on the views and experiences of Africans. The ODA contains our data sets from 39 African countries going back to 1999.
You can search our data sets by country, by survey question, and by survey round. You can compare individual countries and regions, or get the continental view on the topics of your choice. You can slice and dice the data by gender, age, education level, and other demographic variables. You can identify trends over time.

name: ICPAC: IGAD Climate Prediction and Applications Centre

fields.Org Full Name: ICPAC: IGAD Climate Prediction and Applications Centre
fields.Org Description: The IGAD Climate Prediction and Applications Centre (ICPAC) plays a vital role in the humanitarian context of the Greater Horn of Africa (GHA) by providing critical climate services to 11 countries. ICPAC's mission is to foster climate services and knowledge to enhance community resilience in a region highly susceptible to climate change and extreme weather events.

fields.Project/Product Name: E4DRR: Hazard modeling, impact estimation, climate storylines for drought and flood disasters in Eastern Africa
fields.Project Description: CPAC's project is poised to enhance disaster risk management in Eastern Africa by integrating advanced hazard modeling, impact estimation, and climate storylines into the [East Africa Hazard Watch Portal](https://eahazardswatch.icpac.net/map/ea/). This approach aims to fill the critical data gaps for localized, actionable information.

name: FAO: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations

fields.Org Full Name: FAO: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations
fields.Org Description: The Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) is a specialized agency of the United Nations that leads international efforts to defeat hunger.
fields.Org Mission: Our goal is to achieve food security for all and make sure that people have regular access to enough high-quality food to lead active, healthy lives. With 195 members - 194 countries and the European Union, FAO works in over 130 countries worldwide.
fields.Org IATI Name: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

fields.Country Name: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

fields.Project Description: This dataset contains Countries, Commodities and Markets data, sourced from the World Food Programme Price Database. The volume of data means that the actual Food Prices data is in country level datasets. The World Food Programme Price Database covers foods such as maize, rice, beans, fish, and sugar for 98 countries and some 3000 markets. It is updated weekly but contains to a large extent monthly data. The data goes back as far as 1992 for a few countries, although many countries started reporting from 2003 or thereafter.

Driven by regularly collected primary data, its objective is to understand the impact of shocks in food crisis contexts and inform decision-making in support of agricultural livelihoods. The DIEM Hub has been publicly available since June 2021.

FAO’s AQUASTAT is a global water information system offering open-access data on water availability, irrigation, and usage. It supports analysis and decision-making on food security, hydrology, and agricultural planning.

name: UC Irvine: University of California Irvine

fields.Org Full Name: UC Irvine: University of California Irvine
fields.Org Description: University of California, Irvine was founded with a mission to catalyze the community and enhance lives through rigorous academics, cutting-edge research, and dedicated public service. Today, we draw on the unyielding spirit of our pioneering faculty, staff and students who arrived on campus with a dream to inspire change and generate new ideas. We believe that true progress is made when different perspectives come together to advance our understanding of the world around us. And we enlighten our communities and point the way to a better future. At UCI, we shine brighter.

fields.Project Description:
CLIFDEW-GRID, developed by UNHCR in collaboration with the University of California Irvine, is an ambitious initiative dedicated to addressing the complex challenge of climate-induced forced displacement, including through the first risk index of its kind. This project leverages advanced data analytics and innovative approaches to empower CRAF’d ecosystem partners to anticipate and respond effectively to the growing crisis of climate-induced displacement. By forecasting subnational granularity, the project will better accommodate in-country heterogeneity than traditional country-level approaches. It will be piloted for countries in Western and Eastern Africa. 

<https://www.unhcr.org/us/clifdew-grid>
CLIFDEW-GRID is an early warning grid-based modelling system designed to predict potential climate-induced forced displacement. It is a joint innovative data project led by UNHCR and the [University of California Irvine](https://catalogue.uci.edu/schoolofphysicalsciences/departmentofearthsystemscience/) and financed by the Complex Risk Analytics Fund ([CRAF'd](https://crafd.io/data-financing/clifdewgrid)).

fields.Org Description: The World Bank is an international financial institution that provides loans and grants to the governments of low- and middle-income countries for the purposes of economic development.
fields.Org IATI Name: The World Bank or World Bank Trust Funds

fields.Project Description: This platform curates and disseminates datasets, reports, and indicators related to fragility, conflict, and violence. It supports development and humanitarian actors by improving access to evidence on conflict dynamics and institutional resilience.

fields.Project/Product Name: World Bank Living Standards Measurement Study (LSMS)
fields.Project Description: LSMS is the World Bank’s flagship household survey initiative that provides high-quality, nationally representative panel data for analyzing poverty, inequality, and livelihoods. Datasets are downloadable through the World Bank Microdata Library and used to support data-driven policymaking.
The Famine Action Mechanism (FAM) is a global partnership dedicated to scaling up anticipatory and early action to protect lives and livelihoods from emerging food security crises.

GCRP is an integrated analytics platform for assessing and anticipating multidimensional crisis risks. It offers open-access dashboards, country risk profiles, and composite indicators to inform anticipatory action and crisis financing decisions.

The Data Catalog is designed to make World Bank's development data easy to find, download, use, and share. It includes data from the World Bank's [microdata](https://microdata.worldbank.org/), [finances](http://finances.worldbank.org/) and [energy data](https://energydata.info/) platforms, as well as datasets from the [open data catalog.](https://data.worldbank.org/) There are different ways to access and download datasets.

fields.Project/Product Name: World Bank-UNHCR Joint Data Center on Forced Displacement
fields.Project Description: The JDC is a joint initiative to improve the collection, analysis, and use of data on forcibly displaced populations. It provides public goods—surveys, microdata, and research—focused on informing development and humanitarian action through evidence-based approaches.

The Microdata Library is a collection of datasets from the World Bank and other international, regional and national organizations.
The World Bank’s [Microdata Library](http://microdata.worldbank.org/) facilitates access to microdata collected through sample surveys of households, business establishments or other facilities. These microdataprovide information about people living in developing countries, their institutions, their environment, their communities and the operation of their economies. Many of these datasets are available as open data; check the [terms of use](http://microdata.worldbank.org/index.php/terms-of-use) associated with each dataset.

fields.Org Description: The Internal Displacement Monitoring Centre (IDMC) is the world's leading source of data and analysis on internal displacement. Since our establishment in 1998 as part of the Norwegian Refugee Council (NRC), we have offered a rigorous, independent and trusted service to the international community. Our work informs policy and operational decisions that improve the lives of the millions of people living in internal displacement, or at risk of becoming displaced in the future.
fields.Org Mission:
The world's leading source of data and analysis on internal displacement.

We provide high-quality data, analysis and expertise on internal displacement to inform policy and operational decisions that can improve the lives of internally displaced people (IDPs) worldwide and reduce the risk of future displacement.

IDU: <https://www.internal-displacement.org/internal-displacement-updates/>
