fields.Project Description: IDMC's IDU offers preliminary, timely, and detailed insights into new displacement events reflecting our ongoing daily monitoring efforts. This event-based dataset provides initial snapshots of displacement trends which may later be refined and consolidated in the GIDD. It's important to note that these figures do not undergo the same level of quality control as the GIDD data, as the IDU data reflects timely updates that are subject to change as more information becomes available following a displacement event.

fields.Agency/Department Name: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ)
Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT)

fields.Project Description: As part of IDMC's investment in more systematic monitoring of national and global efforts to reduce the risk, scale and negative impacts of internal displacement, the Global Repository of Good Practices provides a platform to compile, share and evaluate policies and programmatic approaches to support better solutions for internally displaced people worldwide.

IDMC conducts annual severity assessments to compare the living conditions of internally displaced households to those of returnee and non-displaced households in the same country, including access to adequate housing, stable income, food security and education, as well as the fear of exposure to conflict or violence, explosive hazards and other threats.

This database is the product of an annual process that involves collecting, harmonizing, and validating data followed by a thorough peer review. We engage with primary data providers and relevant actors at various levels—national, regional, and global. Published annually, the GIDD has been acknowledged by several UN resolutions for its significance. The GIDD data is detailed by country and year for conflict-induced displacement, while disaster-induced displacement is recorded at the event level. Additional disaggregated data is also available since 2023

fields.Agency/Department Name: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ)
Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT)

fields.Project Description: IDMC’s Global Report on Internal Displacement (GRID) is the authoritative source for data and analysis on the state of internal displacement for the previous year. Each year, IDMC presents the validated estimates of internal displacements by conflict and disasters, and the total cumulative numbers of IDPs worldwide. The GRID also provides an overview of the year’s most significant internal displacement situations, highlighting potential measures to address the issue across the humanitarian, development, disaster risk reduction and climate change agendas.

Weather and Climate Risks (WCR) Group at ETH Zurich
CLIMADA Platform: An open-source tool developed by the WCR Group for probabilistic climate risk assessment and adaptation planning. It supports decision-makers in evaluating the impacts of natural hazards and exploring adaptation strategies. ​Weather and Climate Risks
scClim Project: A four-year interdisciplinary initiative funded by the Swiss National Science Foundation. It integrates high-resolution weather predictions with climate simulations to assess hail impacts across various sectors in Switzerland. ​Weather and Climate Risks

SPARCCLE Project: Part of the EU Horizon research program, this project involves collaboration between the WCR and Land-Climate Dynamics groups. It focuses on climate model emulation and natural hazard risk modeling to understand climate extremes' impacts on global ecosystems.

fields.Project Description: CLIMADA is an open-source risk assessment tool that models economic losses from natural hazards using hazard, exposure, and vulnerability data. It supports policy, research, and risk finance decision-making.

The IPC Population Tracking Tool is an online platform that gives the public access to population data from more than 30 different countries. It allows users to download resource data for offline IPC analyses since 2017. All national population figures are based on official country population estimates. IPC estimates are those published in country IPC reports.
Infographics made by IPC

name: The Pacific Community

fields.Org Description: The Pacific Community (SPC) is the principal scientific and technical organisation in the Pacific region, proudly supporting development since 1947. We are an international development organisation owned and governed by our 27 country and territory members. The Pacific Community supports sustainable development by applying a people-centred approach to science, research and technology across all of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). We serve our members by interweaving and harnessing the nexus of climate, ocean, land, culture, rights and good governance; through trusted partnerships; investing in Pacific people; and understanding Pacific contexts.

The United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) is the leading global authority on the environment.
UNEP’s mission is to inspire, inform, and enable nations and peoples to improve their quality of life without compromising that of future generations.

fields.Project/Product Name: UN Environment Programme World Conservation Monitoring Centre (UNEP-WCMC)
fields.Project Description: UNEP‑WCMC is a global science-policy interface that provides open-access datasets and tools on biodiversity, ecosystem services, and conservation strategies. Its data platforms support environmental reporting, climate resilience, and natural capital planning.

fields.Org Description: ACAPS, which originally stood for the "Assessment Capacities Project," is an independent, non-governmental organization that provides humanitarian information and analysis to support better-informed decision-making in crisis situations. It offers data and analysis on global humanitarian crises to organizations like the UN, humanitarian responders, and donors, with the goal of improving aid delivery and efficiency. ACAPS provides global analysis, and works with other organizations to improve evidence-based decision-making in humanitarian response.

fields.Agency/Department Name: Directorate-General for European Civil Protection and Humanitarian Aid Operations (DG ECHO)
Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC)

fields.Project Description: The INFORM Severity Index is an improved way to analyse the severity of humanitarian crises globally. It seeks to contribute to improved management of humanitarian crises by providing decision-makers with a comparable and reliable summary of information about the severity of humanitarian crises that is updated monthly and applicable globally. INFORM partners have been developing the INFORM Severity Index since 2016. It will complement the widely used INFORM Risk Index.
The Global Humanitarian Access Overview is ACAPS’ twice-yearly assessment of the barriers that prevent aid from reaching people in crisis and people in crisis from receiving assistance.

The Risk Radar is a forward-looking analytical tool developed by ACAPS that flags countries and contexts where the humanitarian situation is likely to deteriorate significantly in the next six months. It combines monitoring of hundreds of crises, evaluation of drivers and triggers, and a systematic risk‐analysis methodology (impact × probability) to highlight where urgent attention and preparedness may be needed.

fields.Org Description: The University of Minnesota provides extensive data services and projects through various centers, including the Minnesota Research Data Center (MnRDC), which provides researchers secure access to non-public data from the U.S. Census Bureau and other government agencies. Their data services also encompass data infrastructure assessment, record linkage, machine learning, innovative data capture, and data access and preservation. The IPUMS Center for Data Integration is a prominent provider of census and survey data globally, further showcasing the University's commitment to data integration and research.

fields.Project Description: MPC is an interdisciplinary research center that advances demographic and population studies through large-scale data infrastructure. It supports open-access microdata, spatial data, and survey harmonization efforts across multiple global datasets.

IPUMS provides harmonized, high-quality census and survey data from over 100 countries. Available through an open-access platform, its datasets enable global research on health, population trends, labor, and development outcomes.

name: UNITAR: UN institute for Training and Research

fields.Org Full Name: UNITAR: UN institute for Training and Research
fields.Org Description: UNITAR focuses on building capacity in the use of data for evidence-based decision-making, particularly in developing countries. They organize workshops and develop toolkits on governance for data ecosystems, with a special emphasis on supporting the implementation of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). UNITAR also helps strengthen statistical training at national and local levels, promotes access to statistical learning for data producers, enables the use of new data sources like citizen data, and enhances the effective use of data by policymakers and stakeholders through statistical literacy initiatives.

fields.Project Description: UNOSAT provides geospatial analysis and satellite imagery to support disaster response, humanitarian aid, and sustainable development. It offers on-demand and open-access mapping services through interactive portals, data hubs, and geospatial APIs.

fields.Project/Product Name: Global Disaster Alert and Coordination System (GDACS)
fields.Project Description: GDACS is a cooperation framework between the United Nations, the European Commission and disaster managers worldwide to improve alerts, information exchange and coordination in the first phase after major sudden-onset disasters.

fields.Org Description: IOM works to ensure the dignity, safety and protection of people in the most challenging crisis response contexts in the world.

fields.Project Description: The International Organization for Migration’s Global Data Institute introduces PRIMARI, an ambitious initiative to enhance the grasp on global mobility by consolidating sub-national displacement data with migration insights. This project aims to forge a composite dataset spanning up to 60 countries, drawing on the rich data resources of the Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM). PRIMARI stands out for its commitment to merging diverse data streams into a singular, accessible, and actionable dataset, supported by a comprehensive metadata repository to ensure data transparency and integrity.

The Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM) gathers and analyzes data to disseminate critical multi layered information on the mobility, vulnerabilities, and needs of displaced and mobile populations that enables decision makers and responders to provide these populations with better context specific assistance.
The Migration Data Portal is a unique access point to timely, comprehensive migration statistics and reliable information about migration data globally.

GCRP is a data and analytics platform that aggregates global risk indicators, country profiles, and dashboards to support early-warning, crisis preparedness, and financing decisions across development and humanitarian systems.

fields.Project/Product Name: Humanitarian Data Science and Ethics Group (DSEG)
fields.Project Description: DSEG is a community of practice focused on advancing ethical, responsible, and inclusive data science in humanitarian contexts. It supports standards, tools, and guidance that center protection principles and data accountability.

name: UNESCAP: United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Asia and the Pacific

fields.Org Full Name: UNESCAP: United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Asia and the Pacific
fields.Org Description: UNESCAP leverages data and statistics to address key development challenges in the Asia-Pacific region, providing member states with results-oriented projects, technical assistance, and capacity building. They work across various areas, including macroeconomic policy, poverty reduction, trade, environment, disaster risk reduction, and social development. UNESCAP promotes the use of data for evidence-based decision-making and fosters regional cooperation on transboundary issues, utilizing rigorous analysis and peer learning to inform policy dialogues and recommendations.
The mission of the Water Point Data Exchange (WPdx) is to unlock the potential of water point data to improve rural water services through evidence-based decision-making.

fields.Project Description: The Water Point Data Exchange (WPDx) platform is a global open data system that compiles and standardizes information on water point locations and characteristics from multiple countries. Hosted by the Global Water Challenge, it provides a critical repository for improving water service delivery by offering insights into functionality, service levels, and infrastructure gaps. WPDx data has been used by governments, NGOs, and development partners to enhance resource allocation, plan maintenance, and track progress toward water access goals, contributing to SDG 6.

fields.Org Description: The Partnership in Statistics for Development in the 21st Century (PARIS21) aims to improve the production, quality, availability, and use of statistics for informed decision making for sustainable development. It was established in 1999 by the United Nations, the European Commission, the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD), the International Monetary Fund, and the World Bank as a response to the need for accurate and reliable data to achieve and track progress toward development goals.

ADAPT helps governments assess their statistical capacity, plan national data strategies, and make cost-effective investments in data infrastructure—supporting SDG tracking and capacity development in low- and middle-income countries.

fields.Project/Product Name: Guidelines for National Strategy for the Development of Statistics (NSDS)
fields.Project Description: NSDS by PARIS21 provides structured guidance and tools to help countries design national statistics strategies, align donor support, and integrate data systems for sustainable development planning.
An analytical platform tracking country-level data system development and SDG readiness, providing dashboards and indicators to help align donor support and national priorities.
This is a global platform tracking investments in national statistical systems. It provides open-access monitoring of resource flows, donor commitments, and financing gaps for data for development.

fields.Org Description: The University of Oxford supports researchers and students with a suite of data services, primarily through the Bodleian Data Service, which offers access to statistics and data for secondary use. Oxford also provides research data management services for storing, publishing, and preserving research data outputs. Their Data Reporting, Architecture and Modelling (DRAM) team within IT Services offers comprehensive support for data management, analysis, and reporting, guided by the University IT Strategic Plan and Data Strategy.

fields.Project Description: The global Multidimensional Poverty Index (global MPI) is an annual international measure of acute multidimensional poverty covering over 100 developing countries. It complements traditional monetary poverty measures by capturing the acute, overlapping deprivations in health, education, and living standards that people in poverty face. OPHI computes the global MPI in partnership with the Human Development Report Office of the United Nations Development Programme.

fields.Org Description: iMMAP Inc. is an international nonprofit organization that provides information management services to humanitarian and development organizations, enabling partners to make informed decisions that ultimately provide high-quality targeted assistance to the world’s most vulnerable populations.
fields.Org Mission:
iMMAP Inc.'s mission is to harness the power of information to facilitate evidence-based decisions to improve people’s lives.

iMMAP Inc. turns data into information and creates knowledge for decision-makers operating in development contexts, situations of violence, post-disaster, and conflict recovery.

fields.Project Description: The humanitarian crisis in Nigeria’s northeast states of Borno, Adamawa and Yobe (BAY) continues to severely affect millions of people who remain vulnerable to displacement, impoverishment, and threat of violence. What started as a localized insurgency more than eleven years ago has turned into a regional armed conflict with civilians, mostly women and children bearing the brunt of brutal clashes and attacks.
iMMAP delivers assessment tools, training, and data services to support MSNA-led humanitarian coordination across emergencies—streamlining data aggregation across sectors.

name: WHO: World Health Organization

fields.Org Description: The WHO's purpose is to achieve the highest possible level of health for all the world's people, defining health as "a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being and not merely the absence of disease or infirmity."[5] The main functions of the World Health Organization include promoting the control of epidemic and endemic diseases; providing and improving the teaching and training in public health, the medical treatment of disease, and related matters; and promoting the establishment of international standards for biological products.

fields.Country Name: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

fields.Project Description: WHO offers globally standardized health data through its GHO portal, providing indicators on disease, mortality, and service coverage via APIs and downloadable data under open access licenses.

WHO’s GHO is its flagship global portal for health statistics and indicators. It offers datasets across themes like mortality, disease burden, and service coverage with API access for researchers and policymakers.

EIOS is a real-time platform developed by WHO and the European Commission to collect, verify, and share public health threat information from open sources. It offers a centralized dashboard and alerting system to help health agencies monitor emerging epidemics and coordinate responses.

fields.Project/Product Name: WHO/UNICEF Joint Monitoring Programme for Water Supply, Sanitation and Hygiene (JMP)
fields.Project Description: Tracks access to water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH) using global indicators and household survey data accessible under open access licenses.

fields.Project/Product Name: Surveillance System for Attacks on Health Care (SSA)
fields.Project Description: WHO WHO’s SSA platform collects data on incidents threatening health care in conflict settings and provides dashboards and data for protection analysis.
The HeRAMS Initiative aims to ensure that core information on essential health resources and services is readily available to decision makers at country, regional and global levels.
MAP provides high-resolution maps of malaria risk and stability, combining epidemiological and environmental data to support global health planning, investment, and disease modeling.

The World Health Organization (WHO) Health Emergency Dashboard is a platform which aims to share information about public health events and emergencies. The data on the dashboard is refreshed every thirty (30) minutes and data is accurate as at time of refreshing.

fields.Project/Product Name: Early Warning, Alert and Response System (EWARS)
fields.Project Description: The Early Warning Alert and Response System provides real-time monitoring of epidemic outbreaks. It supports crisis response planning and risk assessment using online reporting platforms and dashboards.

donor_countries: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

name: RCCC: Red Cross Red Crescent Climate Centre

fields.Org Full Name: RCCC: Red Cross Red Crescent Climate Centre
fields.Org Description: The Climate Centre focuses primarily on providing guidance and tools to National Societies and their partners, and fostering the exchange of experience, training and technical back-up for Red Cross Red Crescent volunteers, delegates and managers specializing in the management of disaster risk and health.
fields.Org IATI Name: Red Cross Red Crescent Climate Centre

fields.Project Description: The IFRC Global Disaster Preparedness Center, together with the Red Cross Red Crescent Climate Centre and American Red Cross, develops data-driven tools and best practice templates. The center enables early warning preparedness and resilience building through open guides, scenario modeling tools, and dashboards.

The [International Committee of the Red Cross](https://www.climatecentre.org/) (ICRC), in collaboration with the [Netherlands Red Cross‘ data and digital initiative 510](https://510.global/), one of the largest humanitarian organizations active in fragile and crisis-affected settings—is embarking on an innovative project to intertwine climate risk, displacement, and conflict data into comprehensive risk datasets. This initiative aims to equip the ICRC and the broader humanitarian community with open-source composite datasets and risk indices to enhance decision-making and programming capabilities in sub-Saharan Africa, the Middle East, and North Africa (MENA) regions.

name: ECMWF: European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts

fields.Org Full Name: ECMWF: European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts
fields.Org Description: We are both a research institute and a 24/7 operational service, producing global numerical weather predictions and other data for our Member and Co-operating States and the broader community. We operate a world-class supercomputer facility for weather forecasting and hold one of the largest meteorological data archives. Other strategic activities include delivering advanced training and assisting the WMO in implementing its programmes.

fields.Project Description: C3S provides authoritative, open-access climate data and tools, including forecasts, historical datasets, and impact indicators. Managed by ECMWF, it supports risk analysis, adaptation planning, and policy development globally.

name: DPO: United Nations Department of Peace Operations

fields.Org Full Name: DPO: United Nations Department of Peace Operations
fields.Org Description: The UN Department of Peace Operations (DPO) utilizes data to enhance the effectiveness of peace operations and inform decision-making in conflict and post-conflict settings. They manage the UN Peace and Security Data Hub, a public library of datasets on peace and security, providing centralized access to up-to-date information. The Hub empowers a wide range of users, including UN staff, member states, academia, and the public, with data on peacekeeping mandates, quick impact projects, and other related initiatives. DPO also engages in data-related projects such as predictive modeling with peacekeeping demographic data and quantifying the implementation of the Women, Peace and Security agenda through text analysis.

fields.Project Description: A centralized data library offering curated conflict-related datasets, published by UN DPO to support analytic peace and security programming.

name: INFORM Consortium

fields.Org Description: INFORM is a collaboration of the Inter-Agency Standing Committee Reference Group on Risk, Early Warning and Preparedness and the European Commission. INFORM is developing a suite of quantitative, analytical products to support decision-making on humanitarian crises and disasters.
fields.Org Mission: These help make decisions at different stages of the disaster management cycle, specifically climate adaptation and disaster prevention, preparedness and response. INFORM develops methodologies and tools for use at the global level and also supports their application at subnational level.

fields.Country Name: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

fields.Agency/Department Name: Directorate-General for European Civil Protection and Humanitarian Aid Operations (DG ECHO)

fields.Project Description: The INFORM Severity Index is an improved way to analyse the severity of humanitarian crises globally. It seeks to contribute to improved management of humanitarian crises by providing decision-makers with a comparable and reliable summary of information about the severity of humanitarian crises that is updated monthly and applicable globally. INFORM partners have been developing the INFORM Severity Index since 2016. It will complement the widely used INFORM Risk Index.

INFORM Climate Change Risk Index is an upgrade of INFORM Risk Index as it includes climate and socio-economic projections. It provides quantified estimates of the impacts of climate change on the future risk of humanitarian crises and disasters. The results are intended to inform policy choices across climate mitigation, climate adaptation, disaster risk reduction, sustainable development and humanitarian assistance.

[INFORM Warning](https://drmkc.jrc.ec.europa.eu/inform-index/INFORM-Warning) is a state-of-the-art innovative global risk monitoring tool designed to anticipate complex risks up to a year in advance, directly linked to crisis funding instruments. It transcends traditional methods by presenting multi-hazard information from diverse sources. Its unique analysis offers insights into risk trends, forecasts, scenarios, and potential events leading to crisis impact.

The INFORM Risk Index is a multi-hazard risk assessment tool developed by the Inter-Agency Standing Committee (IASC) and the European Commission. It combines data on hazards, vulnerability, and coping capacity to produce a composite score of disaster risk in over 190 countries. The index supports evidence-based disaster preparedness, humanitarian planning, and crisis response by identifying countries most at risk of crises that could overwhelm national response capacities. It is updated annually and incorporates more than 50 indicators.

fields.Org Description: As an international organization, HERA is dedicated to supporting other humanitarian and development organizations in the implementation of their projects and operational strategies. This includes crafting strategic frameworks, establishing security policies, risk assessment, donor mapping, exploratory missions, and evaluation missions. HERA assists organizations in understanding the evolving landscape of the humanitarian system, particularly regarding epidemic control through epidemiological data collection and climate change adaptation by aiding organizations in measuring their carbon footprint and developing strategies to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

Insecurity Insight examines threats facing people living and working in dangerous environments. Our innovative data collection and analysis methods generate insights relevant for aid workers, aid agencies and those concerned with the protection of health workers, educators, IDPs and refugees. Our aim is to empower those who deliver vital services and to give voices to those affected by insecurity
